name: yvette the pink shrimp
reproduction: The females lay 50,000 to 1 million eggs, which hatch after some 24 hours.

name: surfy the orca
reproduction: Gestation: 16 to 17 months ? birth from autumn to spring. Orca new born ? ~ 1.8 m and ~ 200kg

name: rorry the common rorqual
reproduction: Gestation lasts 11 months. At birth, the calf is 6 meters long and weighs 3 to 4 tonnes.

name: max the blue dolphin
reproduction: Gestation takes place every 2-3 years and lasts 12 months. She gives birth to a single dolphin.

name: cookie the humpback whale
reproduction: Their gestation periods take place in winter with courtship displays. It lasts 12 months and at birth she measure 4 meters and weighs 700kg.

name: fofo the whale shark
reproduction: New born whale shark ? ~ 50cm. Ovoviviparous (eggs develop in its uterus) ? hypothesis

name: dozy the giant squid
reproduction: he giant squid lives at depths exceeding 1,000 meters and is only found on the surface.

name: harry the regalec
reproduction: The laying of eggs takes place between July and December. The eggs float near the surface until they hatch.

name: dipsy the giant octopus
reproduction: Male dies after depositing seed in female's breathing port. The female protects her eggs for 150 days without feeding and dies

name: popole the lute tutle
reproduction: The sexual maturity of is reached around the age of 612; for others, it is between 10 and 12 years old.

name: boop the black seadevils
reproduction: Release floating eggs into the water.

name: scotty the scotoplane
reproduction: Embryos develop into planktotrophic larvae then into doliolaria metamorphose into juvenile sea cucumbers.

name: roberto the cachalot
reproduction: Males engage in fierce battles to conquer females. Gestation from fourteen to sixteen months.

name: pit the great white shark
reproduction: Gestation would range from 12 to 18 months and the female would only reproduce every two years.

name: speedy the snailfish
reproduction: the species lay eggs of relatively large size (diameter up to 9.4 mm or 0.37 inch).

name: marcus the dumbo octuopus
reproduction: There is no special breeding season. The female stores the eggs until the conditions are favorable. She then lays them on the seafloor, where they hatch and survive on their own.
